data.title: V3 win10 websockets
data.body: This PR updates the Windows 10 UWP project to use the new websockets v3.1.0 with openssl as well as other updated dependencies. This PR depends on PR https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-bin/pull/269 for the new external dependencies.

data.title: Workaround fix for issue #17249
Fix typo in ModelData: `matrial` to `material`
data.body: Hello, I found a minor spelling mistake in the `ModelData`, so this PR changes the `matrialId` to `materialId`.

data.title: Attached bitmap label with same texture batch doesn't merge
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1
- devices test on: Mi2S
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r13
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version: vs2015
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add  Bitmap Label to any Sprite
2. Loop the step 1 n time, the draw call will become n.

If the sprite add label,the label batch only work in this sprite.
for example, if 1 sprite adds N bitmap label, the draw call will be 1.
but the the N sprites add N bitmap label, the draw call will be N.
Even the all bitmap use the same texture,but the batch will  not be merged.
I must change the label global z order ,or the batch doesn't merge.

data.title: issue #17305 fix
data.body:
commit: `cocos/audio/win32/AudioCache.h fixed include <AL/al.h>`

fixes #17305

fix based on https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/cmake/Modules/BuildModules.cmake#L30

Tested on visual studio 2015: CMake generated project and default proj.win32

data.title: CMake Visual studio build failed
data.body:
I use CMake build system for build desktop project. This is the easiest way to include third-party libraries in a multi-platform project.  After this commit be43c4210f1dc648a8e8925398fda4cf1b1245ba build audio engine on win32 fails with CMake. Compile error: `cocos2d\cocos\audio/win32/AudioCache.h(35): fatal error C1083: cannot open include file: AL/al.h: No such file or directory`. Seems it wrong include of AL/al.h header file.

- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1
- devices test on: Windows 10
- developing environments
   - VS version: 2015
   - CMake version: 3.6.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create blank cpp project
2. generate visual studio project by `cmake -G 'Visual Studio 14'`
3. try build generated project

data.title: socket.io emit with multiple arguments
data.body:
In socket.io protocol, It is possible to emit an event with multiple arguments i.e. `client.emit("event","arg1","arg2")` but it is not possible in cocos2d implementation.

Also the underlying structure of `SocketIO.cpp` allows this (with multiple call to `packet->addData`), the `emit` signature is limited to a single string argument. 

- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1

data.title: Sprite with  cannot be stretched if in polygon mode
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14.1

Hi, I see a snippet of code in CCSprite.cpp Sprite::setContentSize function: 
```
if (_renderMode == RenderMode::QUAD_BATCHNODE || _renderMode == RenderMode::POLYGON)
        CCLOGWARN("Sprite::setContentSize() doesn't strech the sprite when using BATCHNODE or POLYGON render modes");
```
Are there other ways to stretch the sprite in polygon mode?

data.title: add 'makeRef' for easier making a RefPtr
data.body:
For example:
`    __String *str = __String::create("Hello world!");`
`    auto strRef = RefPtr<__String>(str);`

Now we can refactor it like this

`    __String *str = __String::create("Hello world!");`
`    auto strRef = makeRef(str);`

Change std::sort to std::stable_sort in CCEventDispatcher.cpp
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14
- devices test on: All
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r13
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version: 2015
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add few listeners to the same node "node"

`cocos2d::Director::getInstance()->getEventDispatcher()->addEventListenerWithSceneGraphPriority(listener, node);`
2. Issue: order of dispatching is undetermined ( std::sort is unstable ) 

Proposed fix:
Change std::sort to std::stable_sort in CCEventDispatcher.cpp

Changes should be done in below files:
```
CCEventDispatcher.cpp(277):        std::sort(globalZOrders.begin(), globalZOrders.end(), [](const float a, const float b){
CCEventDispatcher.cpp(1331):    std::sort(sceneGraphListeners->begin(), sceneGraphListeners->end(), [this](const EventListener* l1, const EventListener* l2) {
CCEventDispatcher.cpp(1356):    std::sort(fixedListeners->begin(), fixedListeners->end(), [](const EventListener* l1, const EventListener* l2) {
```

data.title: Disable subpixel rendering for label textures.
data.body: Following [this discussion](http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/set-nodes-position-on-integer-screen-coordinates/31071), this PR allows to disable rendering labels on non integer coordinates, thus avoiding the blurry rendering currently occurring on them.

data.title: Replace unsigned int with size_t to avoid implicit conversion
data.body:
When I try to compile libcocos2d for macOS x86_64 with Xcode 8.2.1, I get a warning about implicit conversion loses integer precision, such as the following:

```
cocos/base/CCDirector.cpp:482:12: warning: implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'size_type' (aka 'unsigned long') to 'unsigned int' [-Wshorten-64-to-32]
    return _projectionMatrixStackList.size();
    ~~~~~~ ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```

At least in this case, the type of size/index for ProjectionMatrixStack seems to prefer `size_t` instead of `unsigned int` because the `Director::_projectionMatrixStackList` is constituted of `std::vector` that uses `size_t` as a `size_type`. So this PR replaces `unsigned int` with `size_t` to avoid the implicit conversion warning. Related PR: https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/16723

Thank you for your time!

data.title: Assert that a node cannot be inserted as a child of itself.
data.body: This commits adds an assert to ensure that a node is not inserted as a descendent of itself.

data.title: Signal the scroll once the list is updated in cocos2d::extension::TableView
data.body: This commit moves the call of `TableViewDelegate::scrollViewDidScroll` such that it becomes the last step in `TableView::scrollViewDidScroll`. Since the delegate may want to read the state of the table's cells or the view's position, it seems necessary to notify it once that the view has updated its state.

data.title: Fix minor typos in comments and docs
data.body: This pull request fixes some minor typos and spelling mistakes in comments and documentation.

data.title: Please update spine runtimes
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.14

After updating spine to the latest version we've experienced problem when opening binary model (.skel). It simply crashes the app while opening file. I had to manually add new spine files, but the problem is some changes in spine methods were made. For example parameters in event listeners. 

I'd be nice if you'll update spine runtimes to the latest version in the next release, so I'd be able to use it.

data.title: Fix variable shadowing warnings
data.body:
I get the following warnings when compiling the latest v3 branch on Xcode 8.2.1:

```
cocos/platform/CCFileUtils.cpp:574:61: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
cocos/platform/CCFileUtils.cpp:606:54: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
cocos/platform/CCFileUtils.cpp:756:58: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
cocos/platform/CCFileUtils.cpp:763:62: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
cocos/platform/CCFileUtils.h:921:45: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
cocos/platform/CCFileUtils.h:921:62: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
cocos/platform/CCFileUtils.h:921:87: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
```

This patch renames several variables which defined inside lambda expression to prevent variable shadowing. Thanks.

data.title: Use range-based for loops to avoid shadowing
data.body:
Hello, when building libcocos2d for Mac using Xcode 8.2.1, I get the following warning message:

```
cocos/ui/UIRichText.cpp:1760:31: warning: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
            for (ssize_t j=0, size = row->size(); j<size; j++)
                              ^
cocos/ui/UIRichText.cpp:1756:26: note: previous declaration is here
        for (size_t i=0, size = _elementRenders.size(); i<size; i++)
                         ^
cocos/ui/UIRichText.cpp:1776:31: warning: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
            for (ssize_t j=0, size = row->size(); j<size; j++)
                              ^
cocos/ui/UIRichText.cpp:1770:26: note: previous declaration is here
        for (size_t i=0, size = _elementRenders.size(); i<size; i++)
                         ^
```

So this commit does the following:

1. Replaces index-based `for` with range-based one, to avoid a local variable shadowing and fix the warning. 
2. Changes tabs to 4 spaces indentation.

Thanks!
